total_impedance_ori_txt: R5 and Rc connected in parallel so Rb=R5*Rc/(R5+Rc)=21 Ohm
R2 and Rf connected in parallel so Re=R2*Rf/(R2+Rf)=10.5 Ohm
R1 and Rh connected in parallel so Rg=R1*Rh/(R1+Rh)=7.29 Ohm
Re and Rg connected in series so Rd=Re+Rg=17.79 Ohm
Rb and Rd connected in parallel so Ra=Rb*Rd/(Rb+Rd)=9.63 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 9.63 Ohm
total_impedance_txt: R5 and Rxyb connected in parallel so Rb=R5*Rxyb/(R5+Rxyb)=21 Ohm
R2 and Rxya connected in parallel so Re=R2*Rxya/(R2+Rxya)=10.5 Ohm
R1 and Rxyc connected in parallel so Rg=R1*Rxyc/(R1+Rxyc)=7.29 Ohm
Re and Rg connected in series so Rd=Re+Rg=17.79 Ohm
Rb and Rd connected in parallel so Ra=Rb*Rd/(Rb+Rd)=9.63 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 9.63 Ohm

request.text: What is the voltage on R1?

solution: This circuit can not be solved by using the standard series-parallel rules
The R6,R4,R3 components form a star connection. We will convert it to delta connection
So we can use standard series-parallel rules for impedance calculation
The new components will be: Rxya=35.00 Ohm,Rxyb=70.00 Ohm,Rxyc=17.50 Ohm
The following formulas are used in the star to delta conversion:
Rxya=(R6*R4+R4*R3+R3*R6)/R3
Rxyb=(R6*R4+R4*R3+R3*R6)/R6
Rxyc=(R6*R4+R4*R3+R3*R6)/R4
This is a DC calculation
At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes (VS1)
R5 and Rxyb connected in parallel so Rb=R5*Rxyb/(R5+Rxyb)=21 Ohm
R2 and Rxya connected in parallel so Re=R2*Rxya/(R2+Rxya)=10.5 Ohm
R1 and Rxyc connected in parallel so Rg=R1*Rxyc/(R1+Rxyc)=7.29 Ohm
Re and Rg connected in series so Rd=Re+Rg=17.79 Ohm
Rb and Rd connected in parallel so Ra=Rb*Rd/(Rb+Rd)=9.63 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 9.63 Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R1
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 120 V.
(1) The components Rb,Rd connected in parallel. The voltage on Rd is 120 V because the voltage on Ra is 120 V
(2) The components Re,Rg connected in series.
(2) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 120 V.
(2) Rg is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rg is Rg/Rd*120 V = 49.18 V.
(3) The components R1,Rxyc connected in parallel. The voltage on R1 is 49.18 V because the voltage on Rg is 49.18 V
